intro: Lagenocarpus warmingii, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. The botanical features of Lagenocarpus warmingii make it a popular specimen in horticulture and botanical gardens.
